pronunciation: REPROVE, [Latin reprobo; re and probo, to prove.]

definitions.text:
1. To blame; censure.
I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices - Psalms 50:8.
2. To charge with fault the face; chide; reprehend. Luke 3:19.
3. To blame for; with of; as, reprove one of laziness.
4. To convince of fault, or make it manifest. John 16:8.
5. To refute; disprove. [Not use.]
6. To excite sense of guilt. The heart or conscience reproves us.
7. To manifest silent disapprobation or blame.
The vicious cannot bear the presence of the good, whose very looks reprove them, whose life is severe, though silent admonition.
